Name: fairfax_county_2007_addresses
Originator: Fairfax County GIS Branch Department of Information Technology
OriginatorSort: Fairfax County GIS Branch Department of Information Technology
Abstract: Point location layer for all Master Address Repository (MAR) addresses associated with parcels,2005  These points are created from the centroid of the parcel in which the address resides

<metadata>
  <idinfo>
    <citation>

        <title>Address points,Fairfax County, VA 2005</title>

</citeinfo>
    </citation>
    <descript>
      <abstract>Point location layer for all Master Address Repository (MAR) addresses associated with parcels,2005  These points are created from the centroid of the parcel in which the address resides</abstract>
      <purpose>This layer is used to identify the geographic location of each address in the Master Address Repository (MAR).  It can be used for searching addresses and labeling the location with the address.</purpose>
    </descript>
    <timeperd>
      <timeinfo>
        <sngdate>
          <caldate>3/15/2005</caldate>
        </sngdate>
      </timeinfo>
      <current>publication date</current>
    </timeperd>
    <status>
      <progress>Complete</progress>
      <update>Continually</update>
    </status>

    </spdom>

  </idinfo>
  <dataqual>
    <attracc>
      <attraccr>The address attribute data was scrubbed during a 8 month project.  The data sources include PAMS (Plans and Agreements Monitoring System) addresses, Department of Tax Administration addresses, Land Development System (LDS) addresses, and Geographic Information Services (GIS) addresses.  The street names were scrubbed and a master street name list was created.  The addresses were then scrubbed and a master address list was created from that.</attraccr>
    </attracc>
    <logic>No formal logical accuracy tests were conducted  </logic>
    <complete>: Data set is considered complete for the information presented, as described in the abstract. Users are advised to read the rest of the metadata record carefully for additional details.</complete>
    <posacc>
      <horizpa>
        <horizpar>The location of the point is at the computed centroid of the parcel in which the address is associated with.  In the case of multiple addresses for a single parcel the points will stack on top of each other.  However, the GIS maintenance staff have the capability to manually move the points to a more appropriate location based on planimetric or ortho imagery source data.</horizpar>
      </horizpa>
      <vertacc>
        <vertaccr>A formal accuracy assessment of the vertical positional information in the data set has either not been conducted, or is not applicable.</vertaccr>
      </vertacc>
    </posacc>

        <srccitea>GIS address layer</srccitea>
        <srccontr/>
      </srcinfo>
      <procstep>
        <procdesc>Data copied from the CD obtained from Fairfax County, VA 2007.
Addresses are added, updated, or removed from the layer on a daily basis based on changes that occur in the Master Address Repository (MAR).  New addresses with a status of Recognized in the MAR are processed.  The parcel is located in the GATE.PARCEL__POLY layer, a centroid is computed for the address location, and a point is created using that coordinate.  The address data is then loaded into the GIS database from the MAR and joined to the address data to form this layer.  When an address is expired in the MAR then the point is moved to an expired address point layer and removed from this layer.</procdesc>
        <srcused>MAR Data</srcused>
        <procdate>Unknown</procdate>
        <srcprod>GIS address layer</srcprod>
